items.name: National Theater of San Salvador
items.address: Calle Delgado, San Salvador, El Salvador
items.description: The National Theater of San Salvador is one of the oldest and most iconic buildings in the country, featuring French Renaissance-style architecture and a rich cultural offering.

items.name: Metropolitan Cathedral of San Salvador
items.address: 6a Avenida Sur, San Salvador, El Salvador
items.description: The Metropolitan Cathedral is a site of great historical and religious significance, where the remains of Monsignor Óscar Romero, a symbol of peace in El Salvador, rest.

items.name: El Boquerón National Park
items.description: Located at the top of the San Salvador Volcano, El Boquerón National Park offers stunning views and natural trails, ideal for ecotourism.

items.name: Joya de Cerén Ruins
items.address: San Juan Opico, La Libertad, El Salvador
items.description: Known as the 'Pompeii of the Americas,' Joya de Cerén is a well-preserved Mayan archaeological site, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

items.name: El Tunco Beach
items.description: One of El Salvador’s most famous surfing destinations, El Tunco is renowned for its breathtaking sunsets and vibrant nightlife.

items.name: National Museum of Anthropology (MUNA)
items.address: Final Calle Circunvalación, San Salvador, El Salvador
items.description: MUNA houses a vast collection of pre-Columbian artifacts and exhibits that narrate the history and culture of El Salvador.

items.name: Route of the Flowers
items.description: A tourist route through picturesque towns, coffee plantations, and food fairs, ideal for enjoying Salvadoran culture and nature.

items.name: Devil’s Gate
items.address: Los Planes de Renderos, San Salvador, El Salvador
items.description: A natural viewpoint with spectacular views and activities such as hiking and climbing, famous for its rock formations.
